helpgrid.innerhtml: The first table displays all of the items and services currently on Purchase Orders for the current Work Order. The second table displays the Purchase Requisitions for the current Work Order.

To find labor available during a specific date range, enter the dates in the Available From and To fields. To see labor available on a specific shift, enter the Shift. To include labor who are already assigned to other jobs, select Include Assigned Labor.
This table displays a list of PMs that require alerting. Select PMs to create Work Orders.

The following assets and locations are safety-related assets for the current work order. Each asset might have safety hazards that affect the work environment of the current work order. Select hazards to Apply to Work Order. To finish, click Done.

The first table displays Price and Cost information for the current Work Order and all of its tasks. The second table displays Price and Cost information for the entire Work Order hierarchy starting from the current Work Order.

The Total Bill Price can be a projected price it does not mean that the work order has been attached to a Bill Batch. The Labor and Service Actual Costs include unapproved transactions. The View Costs dialogue box shows only approved transactions.
